newsitem.title: JAPAN: US Treasuries weaker in Tokyo on Rivlin comments.
newsitem.headline: US Treasuries weaker in Tokyo on Rivlin comments.

text.p: U.S. Treasuries were weaker at the Tokyo midday on Thursday after remarks by Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Alice Rivlin, who said it was unclear if the U.S. economy was slowing to a sustainable level, traders said.
Shorter-end cash prices and futures fell slightly, but aggressive sales were limited as the dollar's firmness against the yen provided some support to prices, they said.
Rivlin said in a television interview that it was a "close call" on whether the Fed should take steps to slow the economy.
"I'm not sure exactly how I feel right now about what we ought to do in July," she said.

"If the results of the inflation data turn out to be bigger than the forecast then the current bullish mood could change," another trader said. "But if the results are in line or smaller than the forecasts then the market has more room to rise." -- Tokyo Treasury Desk +81-3-3432-8785
